employees.notes: Proff lists 30 employees on the company overview page [1].

revenue.notes: Proff reports operating revenue as 267 318 with "Beløp i 1000"; converted to NOK 267,318,000 for this dataset [1].

company.entity_resolution_notes: The entity is resolved as SVALBARD ENERGI AS with org.nr. 927978806, matching Proff, the company website, and official application material to Miljødirektoratet [1][2][4].

srm_assessment.overall_summary: Available Norwegian sources describe electricity and district-heating operations based on diesel equipment/fuel and transition away from coal; no explicit inbound recycled, recovered, or waste-derived input factor was identified [2][3][4].
gaps_and_uncertainties: No public annual/sustainability report was identified in the reviewed sources with a quantified inbound SRM input breakdown [1][2].
Permit-related material reviewed is centered on diesel-based operation and emissions, not on secondary raw material procurement streams [3][4].

evidence.evidence_snippet: Juridisk navn SVALBARD ENERGI AS Org nr 927 978 806
evidence.claim: Legal name and organization number on Proff.

evidence.evidence_snippet: 35.110 Produksjon av elektrisitet fra ikke-fornybare kilder

evidence.claim: Revenue figures are presented in thousands NOK.

evidence.evidence_snippet: Svalbard Energi driver energisystemet i Longyearbyen, og er ansvarlig for produksjon, omsetning og distribusjon av strøm og fjernvarme.
evidence.claim: Company activity is electricity and district-heating supply.

evidence.evidence_snippet: Selskapet produserer strøm i dieselkraftverk, og varme gjennom fyrkjeler drevet på diesel.
søker SEAS om tillatelse til bruk av dieselaggregater, samt to kjeler, som hovedlast for strøm- og fjernvarmeforsyning
evidence.claim: Official hearing text states diesel aggregates/boilers as main load.
Organization number in submitted permit application.

evidence.evidence_snippet: primærforsyningen ved kraftverket er dagens dieselaggregater i dieselkraft vest, samt to eksisterende diesel-fyrkjeler.
evidence.claim: Primary supply is diesel aggregates and diesel boilers.
